Lyrics: Como Santa María guardou de mórte ũa bestiola que chaman donezinna.
Direct Translation: How Holy Mary saved from death a little animal they call doneziña.

Lyrics: Eno pouco e no muito, | en todo lles faz mercee
Direct Translation: The Virgin, Mother of Him Who watches over all,
Poetic Translation: Holy Mary, Virgin Mother Of the Lord Who watches all

Lyrics: aos séus sérvos a Virgen, | Madre do que todo vee.
Direct Translation: has mercy on Her servants, both great and small.
Poetic Translation: Sheds Her mercy on Her servants Low and lofty, great and small.

Lyrics: Desto direi un miragre | grande que fez a Reínna,
Direct Translation: Concerning this, I shall tell a great miracle which the Queen,
Poetic Translation: Here's a miracle I'll tell you Of the Virgin for a king.

Lyrics: Madre de Déus Jesú-Cristo, | a un rei que muito tiínna
Direct Translation: Mother of God Jesus Christ, performed for a king who had placed
Poetic Translation: All his hopes on Her he fastened; He was Hers in everything.

Lyrics: en ela sa asperança, | ca lle fez veer aginna
Direct Translation: all of his hope sin Her, for She caused him in Her mercy to experience sorrow
Poetic Translation: In her mercy, Holy Mary Brought him sorrow harrowing,

Lyrics: pesar e prazer mui grande | dũa ren por sa mercee.
Direct Translation: and then great pleasure over a certain matter.
Poetic Translation: Which became a great elation That the king would long recall.

Lyrics: Este pesar foi por ũa | bestiola que muit' amava
Direct Translation: The sorrow was for a little beast the Galicians call doneziña,
Poetic Translation: All this care was for a ferret (Called a doneziña there),

Lyrics: el Rei, que sigo tragía | e a que mui ben crïava,
Direct Translation: which the king loved dearly and carried with him and carred for tenderly.
Poetic Translation: Which the king adored intensely And took with him everywhere.

Lyrics: a que chaman donezinna | os galegos, e tirava
Direct Translation: He hunted birds out of their nests with it,
Poetic Translation: They would hunt for birds together, As a close, devoted pair;

Lyrics: con ela aves das cóvas, | e de taes óme vee.
Direct Translation: for one sometimes sees ferrets which can do that.
Poetic Translation: Ferrets can be very clever, Coming when their masters call.

Lyrics: Pero esta outras cousas | muitas e bõas fazía
Direct Translation: It did this and many other clever things,
Poetic Translation: Jumping, scampering around him, It did many clever feats,

Lyrics: trebellando e saltando, | onde gran prazer avía
Direct Translation: scampering and jumping, at which the king took great delight.
Poetic Translation: And the king was so delighted, He would give it many treats.

Lyrics: aquel Rei; e por aquesto | atán gran ben lle quería
Direct Translation: Therefore, he was so fond of it that he considered
Poetic Translation: He gave thanks to God in Heaven For a gift so cute and sweet.

Lyrics: que tiínna que fezéra | Déus en dar-lla gran mercee.
Direct Translation: that God had done him a great favor in giving it to him.
Poetic Translation: He adored the little ferret; Nothing else could so enthrall.

Lyrics: E por esto lle fezéra | de fust', en que a guardava,
Direct Translation: Therefore, he made it a pretty little wodden cage in which to keep it
Poetic Translation: Just to keep it safe, he made a Pretty little wodden cage,

Lyrics: ũa arca mui ben feita, | e dentro a ensserrava
Direct Translation: and closed the creature inside
Poetic Translation: Where it slept and night so snugly, Safe where it could not engage

Lyrics: porque mal non recebesse, | ca muito se receava
Direct Translation: so that no harm could come to it, for he was very afraid
Poetic Translation: With the cat, who sees in darkness, And who earns its living wage

Lyrics: do gato, que ena noite | mellor ca no día vee.
Direct Translation: of the cat, which can see better at night than in the daytime.
Poetic Translation: Eating little things like ferrets That in corners creep and crawl.

Lyrics: Onde ll' avẽo un día, | indo per ũa carreira,
Direct Translation: Whereby it happened to him one day while he was riding down a road
Poetic Translation: But it chanced the king was riding Down the road one hapless day

Lyrics: que a quis tirar da arca; | e com' ela é ligeira,
Direct Translation: that he took the ferret out of the cage, and, as it is a very quick animal,
Poetic Translation: And the little cage he opened, Thinking with his friend to play,

Lyrics: caeu ontr' os pés das bestas, | e foi en atal maneira
Direct Translation: it fell under the horses' feet. It happened so suddenly
Poetic Translation: But a ferret's very quick, and Suddenly, without delay,

Lyrics: que el Rei con coita disse: | "Santa María, mercee!
Direct Translation: that the king cried out in alarm: "Holy Mary, have mercy!
Poetic Translation: To beneath the horse's hooves, it Took a swift and fearsome fall.

Lyrics: Guarda-me mia donezinna | que a non pérça per mórte."
Direct Translation: "Save my little ferret, and do not let death take it from me."
Poetic Translation: In alarm, the king cried loudly: "Holy Queen, look down and see!

Lyrics: E quantos alí estavan | ouvéron gran desconórte;
Direct Translation: All those who were there were very distressed,
Poetic Translation: Oh, please save my little ferret; Don't let death take it from me."

Lyrics: ca lle pose o cavalo | del Rei o pé atán fórte
Direct Translation: because the king's horse had stepped down on it
Poetic Translation: Those who heard were very troubled, For no comfort could there be:

Lyrics: sobr' ela, e el Rei disse: | "Ai, varões, quena vee?
Direct Translation: very hard and the king said: "Oh, men, who can see it?
Poetic Translation: For the horse the king was on was Heavy, bred to tramp and brawl.

Lyrics: Dade-mia qual quér que seja, | sequér viva, sequér mórta,
Direct Translation: "Give it back to me however you find it, be it dead or alive,
Poetic Translation: "Men," he said, "Oh, who can see it? Give it here, alive or dead,

Lyrics: e conortar-m-ei con ela | come quen se mal conórta."
Direct Translation: and I shall console myself with it as one who is inconsolable."
Poetic Translation: I'll console myself with crying, Like a man who's list his head."

Lyrics: Entôn fez Santa María, | a que é dos céos pórta,
Direct Translation: Then Holy Mary, who is Gateway to Heaven,
Poetic Translation: But in Heaven's boundless mercy, Mary heard the prayer he said,

Lyrics: que de so o pé saísse | viva pola sa mercee.
Direct Translation: caused it to come out from under the hoof alive by Her great mercy.
Poetic Translation: And from underneath the horses Popped the nimblest beast of all.

Lyrics: Entôn quantos alí éran | e viron tal maravilla
Direct Translation: Then all who were there and saw such a wondrous miracle
Poetic Translation: All beheld this precious wonder Which the Queen of Glory made,

Lyrics: que fezo a Grorïosa, | que é de Déus Madr' e Filla,
Direct Translation: which the Glorious Lady who is Mother and Daughter of God
Poetic Translation: She Who is God's Child and Mother. She the horse could well persuade

Lyrics: en fazer que o cavalo, | que con séu pé tan mal trilla,
Direct Translation: performed by causing the horse, which treads so heavily with its hoof,
Poetic Translation: Not to tread with hooves so heavy, Not to kill it where it played.

Lyrics: nona matasse. E esto | fez aquel que todo vee
Direct Translation: not to kill it. The One Who watches ove rall did this
Poetic Translation: This She asked Her Son in Heaven, in His vast, celestial hall.

Lyrics: Per prazer da Grorïosa, | sa Madr', a que comendada
Direct Translation: to please the Glorious Lady, His Mother, to whom the king
Poetic Translation: He Who watche sover all did This to please His Mother dear,

Lyrics: a ouv' el Rei, u do pée | do cavalo foi trillada.
Direct Translation: had commended the ferret when it was crushed by the hoof of the horse.
Poetic Translation: Whom the king had begged for mercy When he felt that crushing fear.

Lyrics: Porên seja el bẽeito | e ela seja loada,
Direct Translation: Therefore, may He be blessed and She be praised
Poetic Translation: May our Lord be blessed forever; May the Queen our praises hear;

Lyrics: e sempr' ambos de nós ajan | pïedade e mercee.
Direct Translation: and may They both shed Their grace and mercy on us forevermore.
Poetic Translation: May Their perfect grace and mercy On our souls forever fall.

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
